source: Choose between increasing your ability scores or gaining a bonus feat.
Increase two ability scores of your choice by 1 point each, or a single score by 2 points.
You still have ties to the Antiquarians and your relationship with them is already good.
Proficient in Arcana, Nature, and Insight.
Proficient with the Manacalon rosary, supposed to be useful to enchant items.
You start with a good reputation with the clerics of your faith, and have discounts at the main temple in the Principality's capital city.
Proficient in Religion, Nature, and Insight.

When a large or larger creature within one cell of you hits or misses you with an attack, you can use your reaction to attack that creature immediately after its attack, provided that you can see the creature.
When a visible opponent 2 cells or more from you attacks you with a ranged weapon or a spell, you can use your reaction to take a shot after the triggering attack.
Once on each of your turns when you down an opponent, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature.
+1d6 necrotic damage on your first attack of your turn.

Your tenacity can wear down the most potent of foes. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the creature takes an extra 1d8 damage if it's below its hit point maximum. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn.
Can fall without harm from {0} cells.
People from the nobility recognize you as one of them, which can be helpful in some situations.
Proficient in History, Persuasion, and Intimidation
You and allies within 10 feet cannot be frightened while you are conscious. At 18th level, the range becomes 30 feet.
Grants a saving throw bonus to your surrounding allies, equal to your CHA modifier (min 1).
Select an additional feat for your character.
4 hours of meditation are sufficient to rest.
Can use Channel Divinity actions once between rests.
Choose one of the divine domains granted by your deity.
You have been trained to scribe magic scrolls.
Channel Divinity to force undead creatures within 6 cells who can see you to flee, unless they make a successful Wisdom saving throw.
Attack rolls against this creature have advantage
Attack rolls against this creature have disadvantage
Difficult climb surfaces are considered normal for you
Climbing does not cost you extra movement
Can jump at maximum distance without risk.
This creature's attack rolls have advantage
This creature's attack rolls have disadvantage
Advantage on saving throws against being {0}
Disadvantage on saving throws against being {0}
Immunity to {0}: all damage is canceled
On a successful attack, Channel Divinity to add 1d6 to your damage and stun your target (save negates). Increases by 1d6 every 3 levels above level 2.
As an action, gain 3 temporary HP per cleric level. Recovered after a long rest.
Allies in adjacent cells gain +1 on attack rolls, damage, AC, and saving throws.
Use your reaction to become immune to your domain element so it heals you instead of wounding you.
Channel Divinity to cause 3d8 fire damage to a target within 12 cells. A successful Dexterity save halves the damage.
Use Channel Divinity on a target within 12 cells. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw or be pushed away by 2 cells and suffer 2d8 cold damage.
Channel Divinity to cause 1d8 lightning damage to a target within 12 cells. On a failed Dexterity save, the target is also stunned until the end of its next turn.
Advantage to detect traps, hidden doors, and objects
Advantage on ability checks using Arcana, History, and Nature
Channel Divinity to see the immediate future and dodge your enemy's attacks better. For 1 minute, the first attack (except shove) made against you after your turn suffers disadvantage.
You always know the odds when choosing between dialog choices that include an Ability Check (Persuasion, Deception, or Intimidation).

Proficient in Intimidation.
Advantage on Intimidation checks
Channel Divinity when casting an attack spell to impose disadvantage on your target's saving throw.
When a melee attack damages you, you can use your reaction to Channel Divinity and strike back using a melee weapon, adding (2d6 + cleric level) psychic damage.
Advantage on rolls to resist being shoved or moved by magical means
Break the spellcasting concentration of an enemy
When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature other than yourself, you regain hit points equal to (2 x spell level).
When casting a healing spell, the target regains additional HP equal to (2 x spell level).
Restore hit points (5 x cleric level) to one or more allies within 6 cells, up to half their hit point maximum.
As long as you are conscious, you and your fellow party members within 6 cells have advantage on death saving throws.
Channel Divinity to cause pain to enemies within 6 cells. Enemies failing a Wisdom save receive 1d8 necrotic damage and are poisoned.
While camping, reduces the chances of being attacked and prevents from being surprised.

In your list and always prepared: 
{0}

Channel Divinity to engulf a visible enemy within 6 cells with radiant light, causing 1d8 radiant damage + 2 per cleric level (half damage on a successful Constitution saving throw) and cause the blinded condition for 1 minute (negated if saving throw was successful).
Channel Divinity: Herald of the Sun
When you cast Sacred Flame, your target has disadvantage on the saving throw.
Channel divinity to summon a sphere of sunlight, which affects light sensitive creatures and negates areas of darkness.
Heal an ally and remove one detrimental condition.

Saving throw advantage against poison
Resistance to poison damage
You are proficient with all types of crossbows.

Saving throw advantage against Charm
Immunity to magical sleep
Choose one Wizard cantrip, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

Proficient in the Survival and Athletics skills.
Advantage on Survival when hunting
Proficiency in one feat of your choice
Choose one of the following hunting specialties:
Regain a main action immediately. Take a short or long rest to recover this power.
You can attack one more time, per combat turn, when you use the attack or shove actions.
Choose a fighting style as a specialty.
Regain (1d10 + level) HP as a bonus action.
{0} uses his Great Weapons fighting style to reroll a {1} damage die from {2} to {3}.
Can cast spells from the {0} list
Charisma +2, increase 2 other scores by 1 point each.
Common, Elvish, and one language of your choice
Common, Halfling, and one language of your choice
When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, reroll and use the new roll.
{0} is a lucky Halfling and rerolls an awful {1} roll from {2} to {3}.
You are adept at traveling in swamp terrain.
You can move through the space of any creature that is of a larger size than you.
All received "{0}" damage actually heals the creature.
All received "{0}" damage actually heals the creature up to {1} hit points.
Common, Elvish, and one language of your choice
You increase all your ability scores by 1 point, or increase 2 scores by 1 point each and gain a bonus skill and feat.
Common and one language of your choice.
You gain easier access to information and people in official positions.
You can hear about secondary quests that involve criminal activity.
Proficient in Sleight of Hand, Stealth, and Deception.
You learn one additional spell each time you gain a level.
Magical attack, +2 to attack and damage rolls
Magical attack, +3 to attack and damage rolls
Magical attack, +1 to attack and damage rolls
Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
Advantage on shove attempts when using a shield.
While using a shield, gain +2 AC when you have a wall on one of your four sides (no diagonals).
Your weapon attacks count as magical against creatures that are resistant or immune to non-magical attacks.
Cast wizard spells and cantrips of the conjuration, evocation, transmutation, and enchantment schools.
Spend 5 points from your healing pool to cure one disease.
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon, you can spend one spell slot to deal 2d8 additional radiant damage. +1d8 per slot level above 1st, +1d8 when hitting an undead or a fiend.
A pool of healing power - 5 points per paladin level.
Spend points from your healing pool to restore lost HP.
Restores a large number of lost HP.
Spend 5 points from your Lay on Hands healing pool to neutralize one poison.
Select and swear the sacred oath that binds you as a paladin forever!
This creature's type and position are revealed.
You collect plants and craft potions faster than anyone who has not ventured outside a workshop.

Channel Divinity to bless one weapon. For 1 minute, add your Charisma modifier to hit with that weapon (minimum +1). The weapon also emits bright light over 4 cells and dim light over 4 more cells, and its attacks count as magical.
Channel Divinity to force fiends and undead within 6 cells who can see you to flee unless they make a successful Wisdom saving throw.
Channel Divinity to blind opponents within 12 cells who fail a Dexterity save. Creatures with darkvision or better sight in darkness have disadvantage. Blindness lasts 1d4 turns.

Channel Divinity to target one creature within 12 cells, dealing (2d6 + paladin level) fire damage and setting the target on fire. It can make a DC 10 Dexterity check to put out the fire, or sustain 1d6 more fire damage per turn for one minute.
Channel Divinity to gain advantage on Persuasion and Intimidation checks for one hour.
Channel Divinity to deal 1d6 additional radiant damage on attacks which hit opponents with either natural shapeshifting or Darkvision (2d6 if both). The effect lasts for 1 minutes.
Channel Divinity: Scourge of the Hidden
Advantage on melee attack rolls, but enemies also have advantage on attack rolls against a reckless creature.

Your arrow can transform into a vine on impact. The target must make a Strength saving throw or be restrained until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1). All uses recharge at the end of a long rest.
Add your proficiency bonus and INT bonus to your evocation spell damage for 1 minute. Recharges after a long rest.
When you take the oath of Tirmar, you acquire the Tirmarian language.
Select a Ranger Archetype that will guide you in your travels.
Gain advantage on ability checks towards this creature type, and additional damage against it equal to your knowledge level.
You are adept at living and traveling in a certain type of terrain: {0}.
You are adept at living and traveling in a certain type of terrain.
Detects the presence of certain creature types in the location.
When attacking a creature with superior darkvision with a weapon, you add your proficiency bonus to your damage.
When in dim light or darkness, you gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
You can cast a spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.
You can cast a spell as a ritual if the spell has the ritual tag and you have it in your spellbook. You don't need to have the spell prepared.
You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.
Select 2 proficient skills or tools to double their proficiency bonus.
Select a Roguish Archetype that will steer your talents in varying directions.
1d6 extra damage (+1d6 every 2 levels) to one creature you hit with advantage using a finesse or ranged weapon, once per turn. No need for advantage if an active ally is next to the target.
When hitting an enemy on lower ground with a ranged weapon, add your proficiency bonus to the damage.
Climbing no longer costs you extra movement, and difficult climb surfaces are considered normal for you.
As a bonus action, teleport to a cell you can see within 5 cells. Recharges after a rest.
Cast wizard spells and cantrips from the divination, illusion, necromancy, and abjuration schools.
Cunning Action allows you to take the Use an Object action.
Climbing no longer costs you extra movement, difficult climb surfaces are considered normal for you, and you can jump longer distances.
When you have to make a {0} saving throw to take half damage from an effect, instead you take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
Advantage when talking to guards, soldiers, and officers
This kind of Sorr-Akkath seems able to ignore its sensitivity to light.
Remove a beneficial condition from an enemy.
Vulnerable to poison and piercing damage until the end of the next turn.
Curse all enemies in neighboring cells to suffer more damage.
Invisible and ready to perform a deadly attack.
A terrifying shriek that strikes fear into the hearts of men.
A touch of this Sorak causes necrotic damage!

You've seen enough espionage to recognize a fellow spy when you see one.
You can communicate secretly with other spies.
You learned a number of codes used by intelligence organizations in the Eastern Kingdoms, and are able to decipher most of them.
Proficient with Nature and poisoner's kit.
Your base walking speed is 7 cells.
Spells from the Green Magic list are considered wizard spells for you: {0}

Proficiency: Light armor

Proficiency: Shortbow
Fighting Style: Archery

Natural Explorer: You benefit from the same advantages as Rangers when in a forest environment.

Advantage on Arcana, History, and Investigation ability checks
Advantage to copy scrolls to your spellbook
Scroll and potion crafting costs and times are halved

When you select this school at 2nd level, the gold and time required to copy a spell of the {0} school into your spellbook are halved. In addition, you spend half the normal time to craft potions, scrolls, or other items.
Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy {0} spells into your spellbook is halved.
When casting spells from the War list, they count as being cast at one slot level higher than the one you actually use: {0}.
When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage.
See normally in dim light, and in natural darkness as if in dim light.
The creature can see invisible creatures and objects.
Vision is normal and subject to standard lighting conditions.
Within the specified range, a creature with superior Darkvision can see perfectly in all lighting conditions.
Grants you specialization with a certain kind of magic.
You have been trained to scribe magic scrolls and use enchanting equipment.
A creature with Pack Tactics has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
Apply this poison to a target weapon.
Soraks regenerate life when in dim light or darkness.
Defilers regenerate 10 HP per round when in full darkness.
Cutthroats deal 2 mode damage when attacking ranged targets on lower ground.
+2 to AC when not wearing armor or a shield.
This creature can see in normal and magical darkness, and can see through invisibility and illusions.
+2 to CON to a maximum of 20.
Can speak, read, and write dwarvish.
Can use a reaction to reduce the damage of an incoming missile.
Throw the dust in the air to turn all creatures within 2 cells invisible for a few minutes.
+2 to saving throws against Necromancy spells
+2 to saving throws against Abjuration spells
+2 to saving throws against Evocation spells
+2 to saving throws against Illusion spells
+2 to saving throws against Conjuration spells
+2 to saving throws against Enchantment spells
+2 to saving throws against Divination spells
+2 to saving throws against Transmutation spells
Apply this oil to a target weapon.
Advantage on saving throws against spells
Advantage on saving throws against being frightened
A freezing wind blown by the Winter Wolf that deals cold damage.
The Fire Osprey emits a fire blast that damages all surrounding cells.
Can cast spells with a somatic component without a free hand, provided a weapon or shield is being wielded.
Once per turn, Cutthroats deal an additional 1D6 damage to already wounded opponents.
All attacks received are critical hits.
+1D8 radiant damage on weapon attacks, once per turn.

Herald of the Elements: 
Call Upon Fire
The target suffers cold damage and must succeed with a STR save or become restrained until the end of its next turn. Can be used a number of times equal to your WIS bonus until a long rest.

Herald of the Elements: 
Call Upon Cold

The creature in the area must succeed with a CON save or suffer thunder damage and become restrained until the end of their next turn. Can be used a number of times equal to your WIS bonus until a long rest.

Herald of the Elements: 
Call Upon Thunder
You know all languages, written and spoken. In addition, you can identify a magical item once per long rest.
Reveals the magic properties and functions of an item.
Mark a creature you see so it receives additional damage from each attack.
Restrains a creature and inflicts force damage every turn until it succeeds with a WIS save or 1 minute has passed.
Friendly creatures in the aura gain fire resistance and +1 to AC.
Friendly creatures in the aura cannot be charmed while you are conscious.
Friendly creatures in the aura gain superior darkvision and +2 perception.
Choose one of the following options:
Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage.
When a creature hits you with an attack, you gain a +4 bonus to AC against all subsequent attacks made by that creature for the rest of the turn.
Advantage on saving throws against being frightened
Target a creature and attempt to pull it if it fails a STR contest.
While in dim or no light, you have advantage on stealth, perception investigation checks, and gain tremorsense.
You can craft arrows every time you take a short or long rest.

When you are within melee range of an enemy creature, you can use your bonus action to move one cell without provoking opportunity attacks, and gain advantage on your next attack with a ranged weapon this turn.

As a bonus action, you can force a switch of positions with an enemy within melee range by performing a STR vs STR or DEX challenge, just like for shoving. You are not open to opportunity attacks by doing so. If successful, you have advantage to attack this creature until the end of your turn.

Add half of your proficiency bonus (round up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check you make that doesn't already use your proficiency bonus. In addition, both your jumping distance and climbing abilities increase, too.

You can use any melee weapon you are proficient with as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells, and can perform their somatic components with the weapon instead of your hand. Additionally, being next to a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged spell attack rolls.
You are trained to craft basic ammunition with smith's tools: arrows and bolts.
A veil of darkness and despair covers an area around the Defiler. All creatures except Defilers and their brood have disadvantage on attacks.
The target suffers fire damage and must succeed a STR save or be pushed. Can be used a number of times equal to your WIS bonus until a long rest.
A Defiler can drain the life power of the brood it created.

When you are subjected to an area of effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
Sorr-Akkath have a mind of pure darkness. Protected by the gifts of their god, they are oblivious to attempts to charm and dominate.
Having pushed yourself to cope with arcane shock backlash, you become proficient with Constitution saving throws.

You overcharge your mana and become restrained until the end of your turn. However, when you cast an attack spell, your damage dice are always above average. In return, you make a CON saving throw DC 14 and take 2d6 psychic damage if you fail.
When an attacker that you can see hits you with a ranged attack or spell, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.
You can add your Proficiency Bonus to the number of spells you can memorize. You also learn two additional cantrips from the Wizard's list.
Target a creature and move it one cell in any direction if it fails a STR save.
Choose a new fighting style option.
Provided you wield a shield, you can shove an opponent as a bonus action.
You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

You can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. Once camouflaged, you gain +10 DEX (Stealth) while you are standing against a wall. You have to restart the camouflage every time you rest or move to another location.
You attempt to request the help of your deity, with a success chance of 1% per cleric level.
You have advantage on DEX (Stealth) ability checks.

Channel Divinity to force undead creatures within 6 cells who can see you to flee, unless they make a successful Wisdom saving throw.
Undead creatures with a challenge rating of {0} or lower that fail the saving throw are instead destroyed.
If you are targeted by a damaging spell, whether it damages you or not, you can cast a cantrip in reaction on the caster.
When you hit with a melee weapon and deal at least 1 point of damage, your target must make a CON save DC 13 or they will be poisoned for one hour and take an additional 2d6 damage.
The Remorhaz can swallow a creature it has successfully grappled, and will inflict acid damage every turn, unless it receives enough damage to force it to regurgitate.
This dragon can breathe a devastating cone of poison.
Dragons are so powerful that their very presence can terrorize those who lack courage.
Dragons can flap their wings to produce enough wind to propel most humanoids away and knock them prone.
This dragon can breathe a devastating cone of fire.
This dragon can breathe a devastating cone of acid.
Defilers are able to turn into mist and teleport almost at will.
Arrok has become one with the volcano. Standing beside him deals Fire Damage.
The gaze of the emperor paralyzes the weak.
Laethar is able to turn into mist and teleport almost at will.
The spider queen eats one of her spiderlings to recover HP.
The spider queen ejects a volley of small poisoned spikes all around her body.
Phase spiders can change planes at will.
Critical hits are considered normal hits for the creature.
Different sorcerers claim different origins for their innate magic.
You have been trained to brew herbal remedies and use enchanting equipment.
Allows the conversion of spell slots into sorcery points and vice versa, as a bonus action.
Spend sorcery points to create a new spell slot, possibly higher than your maximum spell level
Spend a spell slot to generate a matching number of sorcery points
You gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs. You gain two Metamagic options of your choice
{0} uses Empowered Spell to reroll a {1} damage die from {2} to {3}.
Select the type of dragon (and associated damage type) of your ancestor
Your dragonic ancestry grants you affinity to a specific damage type
You gain one additional hit point per level and your armor class is 13 + dexterity bonus when you are not wearing armor
When dealing spell damage matching your draconic ancestor, you add your charisma modifier to the total
You gain resistance to the damage type of your ancestor for an hour, at the cost of one sorcery point.

Make a melee spell attack. On a successful hit, the target creature takes 1D10+your charisma modifier Force Damage, and you regain 1 Sorcery Point. You need to take a Short Rest to recover this power.
Your Charisma modifier is used (if higher) instead of other ability modifiers on your saving throws against spells and other magic effects.
When you finish a Short Rest, you can regain a number of Sorcery points equal to half your Sorcerer levels (rounded up). You must complete a long rest to use this ability again.
Child of the Rift Origin Spells
Immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of level 1 to 5, roll 1d20. If you roll a 20, your spell slot is not spent
You can use your Bonus Action to spend 1 sorcery point to become harder to hit and achieve better saving throws, until the start of your next turn
You can use your Bonus Action to sacrifice 5 Hit Points, in order to regain immediately one sorcery point. The sacrificed Hit Points are recovered after a Long Rest.
This creature can see in darkness and see invisible creatures.
Whenever your make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.
Whenever an opponent attacks your from a nearby cell, you are granted an immediate melee attack against that opponent.
Whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon, the creature takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage, whether you are spending a spell slot to smite or not
Select one of the multiattack options: Volley or Whirlwind Attack

You can use your action to make a ranged attack against any number of creatures within 10 feet of a point you can see within your weapons range. You must have ammunition for each target, as normal, and you make a separate attack roll for each target
You can use your action to make a melee attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll for each target
If you are using a ranged weapon against an enemy, your bonus action can be used to make an additional ranged attack on the same target
At 3rd level, you choose a path that shapes the nature of your rage.

In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action. This grants you advantage on strength saves & checks, an initial +2 bonus to melee attacks damage, and resistance to slashing, bludgeoning and piercing damage, for 1 minute, or if you do not attack or suffer damage between your turns.
You start with 2 rages between each long rest.
You can rage one additional time per long rest
While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit
You have advantage on DEX saving throw to effects and spells, as long as your are not blinded or incapacitated
Your speed increases by 10 feet while you arent wearing heavy armor

Your instincts are so honed that you have advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally, if you are surprised at the beginning of combat and arent incapacitated, you can  act normally on your first turn, but only if you enter your rage before doing anything else on that turn
You can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra  damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.
Add another damage die to critical hits

If you drop to 0 hit points while youre raging and dont die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead.  Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you  finish a short or long rest, the DC resets to 10

You can go into a frenzy when you rage. If you do so, for the duration of your rage you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your  turns after this one. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion.
As long as you rage, you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your  turns after this one. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion.
You can't be charmed or frightened while raging.
Frighten a creature until the end of your next turn if is fails a WIS saving throw against your CHA ability.
Life in the Marches taught you everything you need to survive in hars environments.
When you own nothing, you need to make your own equipment. That's what you did.
At 2nd level, you choose a Druid Circle that further defines your relationship to Nature.
You cannot wear any armor made of: {0}
Learn a druid cantrip of your choice
Select a terrain to grant a range of spells which are always considered as prepared for you.
Moving through difficult terrain does not cost extra movement and you are immune to magical plant which impedede your movement, such as the Entangle or Spike Growth spells
You are immune to being charmed or frightened by elementals or fey, and you are immune to poison and disease
